roleset.name: to contaminate, deteriorate from normal standard, turning bad
roleset.note: CORRUPT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'corrupt' based on ectb2 instances. VerbNet entry 45.4. (from corrupt.01-v predicate notes)
CORRUPTION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, corrupt.01. Corresponds to VNcls other_cos-45.4. (from corruption.01-n)
CORRUPT-J NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. VerbNet entry 45.4. frame by Claire. Based on noun frame corruption.01. (from corrupt.01-j)

role.descr: specific aspect of arg1 being corrupted

example.name: Transitive
example.text: ...There is no evidence *0*-1 * to suggest that he either corrupted their data or sold it for gain.

example.name: args 1 and 3
example.text: In this second of a trilogy aiming at an expos? of contemporary business and social corruption of New York, Mr. Sinclair reveals the rottenness of Wall Street's high finance.

example.name: args 0 and 1
example.text: The "crooked" reference applies to their corruption of the court.

example.name: Args 1, 3
example.text: There is no point in having a booming economy if the country is socially corrupt.
